Questions.text: Have you been on a date in the last month?

answers.text: Yes, multiple times
Yes, once or twice
No, but I’ve been trying to get one
No, I haven’t really tried
No, I’m not interested in dating right now

Questions.text: Do you know what you’re looking for from your date?

answers.text: Yes, I have a clear idea of what I want in a relationship
Mostly, but I’m still figuring some things out
Somewhat, I have a general idea but no specifics
Not really, I just go with the flow
No, I haven’t thought about it much

Questions.text: Do you have something specific that you could do for a date?

answers.text: Yes, I have multiple date ideas ready
Yes, I have at least one solid idea
I have some ideas, but I’d need to plan more
Not really, I struggle to come up with ideas
No, I have no idea what to do for a date

Questions.text: What is your process for trying to get a date?

answers.text: I actively ask people out and make plans regularly
I show interest and take action when I meet someone I like
I wait for opportunities to come up naturally
I rarely take initiative but would like to date
I don’t have a process and haven’t tried getting a date

Questions.text: How often do you attend social events and put yourself out there to meet new people?

answers.text: Very often – I actively seek out social opportunities and engage with new people regularly
Often – I attend social events and try to meet new people when possible
Sometimes – I go to social events but don’t always put myself out there
Rarely – I occasionally attend events but usually keep to myself
Never – I don’t attend social events or make an effort to meet new people

Questions.text: Are you somebody you would want to date?

answers.text: Yes, absolutely—I have qualities I’d appreciate in a partner
Yes, for the most part, but I have things I’m working on
I’m not sure, I have both strengths and areas to improve
Not really, I feel like I need to work on myself more
No, I don’t think I’d enjoy dating someone like me

Questions.text: How much do you love yourself?

answers.text: Completely—I accept and appreciate myself fully
Somewhat—I generally like myself but have insecurities
Neutral—I don’t think about it much
Not very much—I often struggle with self-worth
Not at all—I don’t feel good about myself

Questions.text: Are you willing to compromise in a relationship?

answers.text: Yes, I’m open to compromise and finding balance
Yes, but only on certain things
It depends on the situation
Not really, I prefer things my way
No, I struggle with compromising in relationships

Questions.text: How well do you understand your own emotional needs and boundaries?

answers.text: I know exactly what I need and how to communicate it
I have some idea but struggle to express it
I’m still figuring out what my needs and boundaries are
I often put others’ needs ahead of mine and ignore my own
I don’t think much about my emotional needs

Questions.text: Are you confident in your own decisions?

answers.text: Yes, completely—I trust myself fully
Yes, somewhat—I usually trust my decisions but sometimes doubt myself
No, not completely—I often second-guess my choices
No, not at all—I struggle with making and sticking to decisions

Questions.text: Can you comfortably hold consistent conversations with the opposite gender?

answers.text: Yes, very comfortably—I can hold engaging conversations easily
Yes, but I sometimes feel nervous or unsure
Somewhat—I can hold conversations but struggle with consistency
No, I find it difficult and sometimes avoid it
No, I feel very uncomfortable talking to the opposite gender

Questions.text: How likely are you to ask someone out over text rather than in person?

answers.text: 1 - I would only ask in person
5 - I would only ask over text

Questions.text: How often do you have serious conversations with your partner?

answers.text: Very often—we have deep conversations regularly
Often—we have serious talks when needed
Sometimes—we talk about important things occasionally
Rarely—we mostly keep things lighthearted
Never—we don’t have serious conversations

Questions.text: How comfortable are you with expressing your feelings and thoughts in a relationship?

answers.text: Very comfortable—I share my thoughts and feelings openly
Somewhat comfortable—I express myself but with some hesitation
Neutral—I don’t avoid it, but I don’t seek it out either
Somewhat uncomfortable—I struggle to express myself fully
Very uncomfortable—I rarely express my true thoughts and feelings

Questions.text: When someone shares their feelings with you, how do you usually respond?

answers.text: I listen attentively and respond thoughtfully
I listen but sometimes struggle to respond appropriately
I try to listen, but I get distracted or unsure of how to react
I tend to change the topic or avoid deep conversations
I feel uncomfortable and prefer not to engage in emotional talks

Questions.text: What are your expectations regarding personal growth in a relationship?

answers.text: I want a relationship that constantly challenges me to grow
I value growth, but I prefer it to happen naturally over time
I think growth is important, but not a major focus in a relationship
I don’t see personal growth as a priority in a relationship
I haven’t thought much about personal growth in relationships

Questions.text: What personality traits in a partner would complement you best?

answers.text: Someone who challenges me and helps me grow
Someone who provides stability and emotional security
Someone who shares my interests and lifestyle
Someone who is easygoing and adaptable
I’m not sure what would complement me best

Questions.text: Do you often feel like you have to hide parts of yourself to be in a relationship?

answers.text: Yes, often—I feel like I can’t fully be myself
Sometimes—I hold back certain aspects of myself

No, I feel completely comfortable being myself

answers.text: Companionship and emotional support
Finding a lifelong partner
Personal growth and shared experiences
Having fun without serious commitment

answers.text: Every day, as much as possible

Questions.text: How likely are you to say no to something you aren’t comfortable with?

answers.text: 1 - I struggle to say no
5 - I confidently set boundaries and stand by them

Not well – I take it personally and struggle with it
Not well at all – I feel hurt and dwell on criticism for a long time

I get defensive or angry when confronted
I shut down emotionally and withdraw
I try to compromise but struggle to express my own needs
